result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael W Bates was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Added to payment plan granted in 16CT57.    Failure to pay any part of this fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  $15.00 payment plan fee added.
Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael W Bates

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Payment Plan Request.  Request to lower payments.  Granted $50.00/month beginning 3-3-17.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael W Bates
Current: W12299 Moore Rd, Humbird, WI 54746 United States  (Effective: 02-20-2017)
Prior: C/o Eau Claire County Jail, 728 2nd Ave, Eau Claire, WI 54701

Defendant plead no contest to OWI 2nd in 16CT57.  Defendant plead no contest to the charge in 16CM96.   Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the counts he plead to.  Prior confirmed by the court.   Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of OWI 2nd contrary to 346.63(1)(a) and Resisting/Obstructing contrary to 946.41(1).  Joint recommendation for:  16CT57.  $1429.00.  15 days jail.  12 Mo DL rev & IID.  Alcohol assessment and DSP.  16CM96.  $100.00 fine, plus costs.  

Court ordered: in 16CT57.  $1429.00.  15 days jail.  Start today.   May serve in Eau Claire County.   12 Mo DL rev & IID.  Alcohol assessment and driver's safety plan.    Failure to pay any part of the fine and court costs will result in 30 days jail.   ..16CM96.  $150.00 fine, plus costs.  Pay all @ $100.00 per month, starting 12/1/16.  DNA sample.  Find refusal reasonable.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Poss.
This IA rescheduled to consolidate hearings at same time as other cases of defendant.
Initial appearance on July 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
